concept_data.title: Management Committee for the Common Organisation of Agricultural Markets

summary: The "Management Committee for the Common Organisation of Agricultural Markets," also known as the "EU agriculture committee," plays a pivotal role in the regulatory framework governing agricultural policy within the EU. This committee oversees the apportionment of resources among various agricultural sectors, including silkworms, poultrymeat, and rice. Participants engage in plenary sessions to discuss alterations in modalities for conservation and exploitation of agricultural products. The committee is responsible for drafting regulations that affect traders and occupations related to horticulture, ornamental foliage, and other crops. By retaining seats for diverse stakeholders, the committee ensures appropriate representation and facilitates the dissemination of best practices across member states.
